meanings.definition: superlative form of 'lingy', meaning sticky or adhesive
meanings.sent1: The gum was the lingiest substance I had ever encountered.
meanings.sent2: Her hands were covered in the lingiest glue after the craft project.
meanings.sent3: The lingiest tape in the world refused to let go of the box.
meanings.sent4: The spider's web was the lingiest trap for unsuspecting insects.
meanings.sent5: The lingiest honey stuck to the spoon like a magnet.

meanings.definition: in a sticky or adhesive manner
meanings.sent1: She held on lingiest to the railing as the ship rocked.
meanings.sent2: The sticker clung lingiest to the paper, refusing to come off.
meanings.sent3: The slime slid lingiest down the wall, leaving a trail behind.
meanings.sent4: The tape held the pieces together lingiest during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The syrup dripped lingiest from the pancake onto the plate.

meanings.definition: a person or thing that is sticky or adhesive
meanings.sent1: The little boy was known as the lingiest in the class, always getting stuck to things.
meanings.sent2: The fly got caught in the lingiest of webs spun by the spider.
meanings.sent3: The lingiest of all the stickers in the pack was the one with the smiley face.
meanings.sent4: The lingiest of the candies was the one that got stuck to the wrapper.
meanings.sent5: The lingiest of the tree sap dripped slowly to the ground below.
